abstract: Merging Kraft and Heinz will take up 3G’s attention for some time. But when 3G is again ready to make a deal, Warren Buffett will be, too.
snippet: Merging Kraft and Heinz will take up 3G’s attention for some time. But when 3G is again ready to make a deal, Warren Buffett will be, too.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett and 3G Capital have created a fearsome merger and acquisition machine. The deal on Wednesday to merge the consumer food giants Kraft and H.J. Heinz, worth some $80 billion, is the boldest collaboration yet between the Sage of Omaha and the Brazilian investors behind Anheuser-Busch InBev, after earlier swoops on Heinz and Tim Hortons. The only barrier to even bigger deals may be 3G’s capacity for new projects.

headline.main: Warren Buffett and 3G May Have One Barrier to Even Bigger Deals
